comment._content:
Palazzo Vendramin-Calerghi is well-known for being the deathplace of the german composer Richard Wagner in 1883. He died there in the side wing on February, 13th. 
Little-known is that the Palazzo was leased by a second German. Karl Gustav Vollmoeller, an author and prosperous entrepreneur between the two World Wars, was a tenant of the Palazzo between 1919 and 1938, when the fascist administration confiscated his property (including a marvellous collection of exquisite furniture, carpets and paintings). Vollmoeller was a member of the circle of Stefan George and in 1929 the scriptwriter of the german movie "Der Blaue Engel" with Marlene Dietrich in her first leading role. He also was a talent seeker for Hollywood, where he died in 1948.
